definition[0]: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them
example[1]: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity.
definition[1]: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them
example[3]: Declines in factory jobs and hours worked mean that only more productivity per worker could have raised output in May.
example[4]: Strong manufacturingproductivity growth reduced the number of manufacturing workers needed.
